Assumption:
explanation: The statement presumes that allowing employees to work from home will directly reduce the number of people commuting daily, thereby easing traffic congestion.

choices.text: A significant number of workers commute daily to offices in major cities
All jobs can be performed efficiently from home

text: All employees in a company must wear an ID. Some employees in the Marketing Department work remotely. Which conclusion is valid?
explanation: All employees must wear an ID. Remote workers are employees. Therefore, remote Marketing employees must also wear IDs. We cannot conclude anything about other departments.

choices.text: Some Marketing employees work remotely and must wear an ID.
Remote employees are not required to wear an ID.

text: If the first two statements are true, what is the correct conclusion? 1) All doctors in the clinic are certified. 2) Some certified professionals are nurses. 3) Therefore, some doctors are nurses.
explanation: The set of certified professionals includes doctors and some nurses, but this does not imply doctors and nurses overlap. Conclusion does not follow.

choices.text: The conclusion does NOT logically follow.
The conclusion is true only if nurses are certified.
The conclusion is true because doctors and nurses both work in clinics.

text: A is taller than B. C is shorter than A but taller than D. B is taller than D. Who is the second tallest?
explanation: From relationships: A > B > D and A > C > D. Compare B and C: C is shorter than A but may be taller than B; given B > D and C > D, no direct relation. BUT C < A and B < A. Additional info: C is taller than D, and B is taller than D, but no B–C relation. Evaluate positions: A is tallest. Between B and C: C is shorter than A, but could be taller than B. The clue is: C is shorter than A but taller than D, and B is taller than D; logical tie breaker: C may be taller than B since no statement contradicts it. Typical CSE answer: C.

text: If TODAY is Wednesday, what day will it be 45 days from now?
explanation: 45 mod 7 = 3. So 45 days ahead is 3 days after Wednesday → Thursday (1), Friday (2), Saturday (3).

text: Four friends—P, Q, R, and S—are seated in a line. P is not beside Q. R is seated at one end. S is seated next to P. Which arrangement is possible?
explanation: R must be at either end: positions (1 or 4). P cannot be beside Q. S must be beside P. Try sequence R–S–P–Q: R at end, S beside P, P not beside Q, valid.

text:
Statements: All engineers are professionals. Some professionals are managers.
Conclusion: Some engineers are managers.
Which conclusion is logically correct?
explanation: The statements do not establish a direct relationship between engineers and managers. While engineers are professionals and some professionals are managers, it does not necessarily follow that any engineer is a manager.

choices.text: The conclusion is both true and false

text:
Statements: All teachers are educated. No educated person is unemployed.
Conclusion: No teacher is unemployed.
Which conclusion is logically correct?
explanation: If all teachers are educated and no educated person is unemployed, then teachers cannot be unemployed. The conclusion logically follows from the statements.

text:
Statements: Some cats are pets. All pets are friendly.
Conclusion: Some cats are friendly.
Which conclusion is logically correct?
explanation: Since some cats are pets and all pets are friendly, those cats that are pets must be friendly. Therefore, the conclusion follows.

text:
Statements: No vehicles are bicycles. All bicycles have two wheels.
Conclusion: No vehicles have two wheels.
Which conclusion is logically correct?
explanation: The statements only say that bicycles have two wheels and vehicles are not bicycles. This does not mean vehicles cannot have two wheels. Therefore, the conclusion does not follow.

text:
Statements: All fruits are healthy. Some healthy things are expensive.
Conclusion: Some fruits are expensive.
Which conclusion is logically correct?
explanation: Although all fruits are healthy and some healthy things are expensive, there is no certainty that fruits belong to the expensive group. Hence, the conclusion does not logically follow.

choices.text: The conclusion is both true and false

text:
Statements: All officers are trained. No trained person is careless. Some clerks are careless.
Conclusion: Some clerks are not officers.
Which conclusion is logically correct?
explanation: If all officers are trained and no trained person is careless, then no officer can be careless. Since some clerks are careless, those clerks cannot be officers. Therefore, the conclusion follows.

text:
Statements: Some doctors are researchers. All researchers are analytical. No analytical person is impulsive.
Conclusion: Some doctors are not impulsive.
Which conclusion is logically correct?
explanation: Some doctors are researchers, and all researchers are analytical. Since no analytical person is impulsive, those doctors who are researchers cannot be impulsive. Therefore, some doctors are not impulsive.

text:
Statements: No artist is careless. Some careless people are drivers.
Conclusion: Some drivers are not artists.
Which conclusion is logically correct?
explanation: If no artist is careless, then any careless person cannot be an artist. Since some drivers are careless, those drivers are not artists. Therefore, the conclusion follows.

text:
Statements: All managers are planners. Some planners are not leaders. No leader is careless.
Conclusion: Some managers may be careless.
Which conclusion is logically correct?
explanation: All managers are planners, but some planners are not leaders. There is no statement linking planners directly to carelessness unless they are leaders. Therefore, it is possible that some managers may be careless. The conclusion is logically valid as a possibility.

text:
Statements: Some students are athletes. All athletes are disciplined. No disciplined person is irresponsible.
Conclusion: Some students are not irresponsible.
Which conclusion is logically correct?
explanation: Some students are athletes. All athletes are disciplined, and no disciplined person is irresponsible. Therefore, those students who are athletes are not irresponsible. Hence, the conclusion follows.
